thread.title: Police: Jong-nam's body will not be released until DNA sample given
thread.title_full: Police: Jong-nam's body will not be released until DNA sample given

title: Police: Jong-nam's body will not be released until DNA sample given

persons.name: datuk seri dr ahmad zahid hamidi

text:
Friday, 17 February 2017 | MYT 11:25 AM Police: Jong-nam's body will not be released until DNA sample given 
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia will not release the body of the half-brother of North Korea’s leader until his family has provided a DNA sample despite Pyongyang’s request that the remains be returned. 
"So far no family member or next of kin has come to identify or claim the body. We need a DNA sample of a family member to match the profile of the dead person,” Selangor state police chief Abdul Samah Mat told AFP on Friday. 
"North Korea has submitted a request to claim the body, but before we release the body we have to identify who the body belongs to,” 
Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi on Thursday confirmed that the man, who was killed at a KLIA2 on Monday was Kim Jong-nam ( pix ), the estranged sibling of Kim Jong-un, referring to the passport carried by him. 
Dr Ahmad Zahid also said Malaysia would be willing to accommodate a request from Pyongyang to return the body. 
Jong-nam, 45, was believed to have been in Malaysia on a passport bearing the name Kim Chol, a known alias, according to South Korean media.
